Stem: In a well-run clinical trial of a new drug, patients who consistently took the drug had better health outcomes than those who frequently missed doses. Assuming neither the drug’s efficacy nor a placebo effect explain this, what's the most likely explanation?

ScenarioDefinition.Context: Clinical trial for a new drug.
ScenarioDefinition.Observed_Association: High adherence correlated with better outcomes.
ScenarioDefinition.Constraint_1: Outcome is NOT caused by drug efficacy.
ScenarioDefinition.Constraint_2: Outcome is NOT caused by placebo effect.

ThemeRegistry.description: Adherers tend to practice other healthy behaviors (diet, exercise, following medical advice) which lead to better outcomes (Healthy Adherer Effect).
Personality traits like conscientiousness or discipline lead both to better adherence and better outcomes.
Patients with more stable lives, support systems, or higher SES are more able to adhere and also have better outcomes independently.
Patients whose health was deteriorating or who felt sicker were less likely to remember or be able to take their pills.
Aliases: getting sicker leads to missed doses

RejectsAssumption.text: The drug worked for the people who took it consistently.
RejectsAssumption.explanation: Violates the constraint that efficacy is not the cause.

RejectsAssumption.text: Taking the pills made them feel better due to a placebo.
RejectsAssumption.explanation: Violates the constraint that placebo effect is not the cause.

NotSpecific.text: The adherent people were different from the non-adherent people.
NotSpecific.explanation: Too vague—must specify how and why that difference drives outcomes.
Names the concept but not the specific factor (e.g., healthy behaviors).

Good.text: People who remember to take pills daily are also more likely to exercise and follow health advice, which improves outcomes.

MultipleExplanation.text: One explanation at a time, please—send just one.

Good.text: Thanks. That is a plausible explanation.

NotDistinct.text: Too similar to an earlier idea—try a different mechanism.

NotSpecific.text: Please specify the concrete factor and how it affects outcomes.

NotClear.text: I didn’t follow—clarify how adherence correlates with other factors that drive outcomes.

NotPlausible.text: Let’s try a more realistic reason consistent with the constraints.

NotRelevant.text: Please focus on explaining the observed association within the given constraints.

RejectsAssumption.text: Remember: neither efficacy nor placebo explains this. Offer an explanation consistent with the constraints instead.
